answers.answer: Haha yeah I was a real tiny person before and have gained 40+ pounds too! And yes, once baby got big, his kicks and movements are not always pleasant lol they do hurt sometimes. I'd say the round ligament pain and heartburn is worse though lol

Talk about pains and aches. I had an awesome pregnancy with my first, with my daughter it was like I didn't even know I was pregnant except of the big belly. With my second, my son, it was so painful, I suffered from sciatica and it hurt so bad, I couldn't even get out of bed or get up once I sat down. I had never felt pain like that and then towards the end I was diagnosed with preeclampsia and was going to be induced but he decided to come on its own. Now with this pregnancy, I had nausea pretty bad the first trimester. And now that I'm 26+ days, the baby won't stop putting pressure on the right side of my ribs, I can't breath right and it gets super uncomfortable and the sciatica is back and with my 20 month old running around is worse. I still have way to go, so I just try to take one day at a time. At least your close. Good luck! God bless!

question: I'm 35 weeks today n d longer im pregnant the more n more it becomes painful when she moves..I'm originally a slim person but gain 40+ lbs since being pregnant. I'm at the point where I'm over being pregnant. This is my first child BTW but my husband wants another but if its anything like this im done wit one
title: am i the only one
